content:
Hey everyone.

When using a paginated questionnaire, I would like to have a sort of summary page as the last page. This page would show all the details the user has entered across the multiple pages. They can use this to verify the information entered before saving. Any idea how I can go about implementing this?

That sounds like a functionality for the form filler tool rather than the Questionnaire itself. In theory you could have a final page group with a display item that's auto-calculated from everything filled in so far, but it wouldn't be editable
Thanks for your response. Yes, its not meant to be editable so that's not a problem. Could you point me to any documentation or examples on performing this calculation?
You'd be using the 'calculated-value' extension on a 'display' item. Take a look at the advanced-behavior profile and Using expressions page in the SDC IG.
Thank you so much. Will look into this.
Khumbo Lihonga has marked this topic as resolved.
